titleStmt.title: The grand case of subjection to the higher powers in matters of religion resolved to which is added an appendix to a late book intituled A plea for liberty of conscience, wherein the kings supream power in ecclesiastical matters is asserted ... / by James Jones, a Protestant-dissenter, and now a prisoner in Woodstreet-compter for nonconformity.
titleStmt.author: Jones, James, fl. 1683-1684.

titleStmt.title: The grand case of subjection to the higher powers in matters of religion resolved to which is added an appendix to a late book intituled A plea for liberty of conscience, wherein the kings supream power in ecclesiastical matters is asserted ... / by James Jones, a Protestant-dissenter, and now a prisoner in Woodstreet-compter for nonconformity.
titleStmt.author: Jones, James, fl. 1683-1684.

notesStmt.note: Imperfect: stained, with slight loss of print.
Reproduction of original in the Huntington Library.
